name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: [MUSIC]

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: This lecture is about topic mining and analysis.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: We're going to talk about using a term as topic.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: This is a slide that you have seen in a earlier lecture

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: where we define the task of topic mining and analysis.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _We also raised the question
column6: how do we exactly define the topic of theta? _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So in this lecture
column6: we're going to offer one way to define it

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: that's our initial idea.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: Our idea here is defining a topic simply as a term.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: A term can be a word or a phrase.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _And in general
column6: we can use these terms to describe topics. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So our first thought is just to define a topic as one term.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _For example
column6: we might have terms like sports

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: as you see here.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Now if we define a topic in this way

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we can then analyze the coverage of such topics in each document.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Here for example

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we might want to discover to what extent document one covers sports.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: And we found that 30% of the content of document one is about sports.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _And 12% is about the travel
column6: etc. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: We might also discover document two does not cover sports at all.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So the coverage is zero
column6: etc. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So now
column6: of course
column7: as we discussed in the task definition for _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _topic mining and analysis
column6: we have two tasks. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: One is to discover the topics.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: And the second is to analyze coverage.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So let's first think about how we can discover

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: topics if we represent each topic by a term.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So that means we need to mine k topical terms from a collection.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Now there are
column6: of course
column7: many different ways of doing that. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _And we're going to talk about a natural way of doing that

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: which is also likely effective.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So first of all

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we're going to parse the text data in the collection to obtain candidate terms.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: Here candidate terms can be words or phrases.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: Let's say the simplest solution is to just take each word as a term.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: These words then become candidate topics.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: Then we're going to design a scoring function to match how good each term

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: is as a topic.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So how can we design such a function?

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: Well there are many things that we can consider.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _For example
column6: we can use pure statistics to design such a scoring function. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Intuitively
column6: we would like to favor representative terms

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: meaning terms that can represent a lot of content in the collection.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So that would mean we want to favor a frequent term.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _However
column6: if we simply use the frequency to design the scoring function

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: then the highest scored terms would be general terms or

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _functional terms like the
column6: etc. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: Those terms occur very frequently English.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So we also want to avoid having such words on the top so

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we want to penalize such words.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _But in general
column6: we would like to favor terms that are fairly frequent but _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: not so frequent.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So a particular approach could be based on TF-IDF weighting from retrieval.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: And TF stands for term frequency.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: IDF stands for inverse document frequency.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: We talked about some of these

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: ideas in the lectures about the discovery of word associations.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So these are statistical methods

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: meaning that the function is defined mostly based on statistics.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So the scoring function would be very general.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _It can be applied to any language
column6: any text. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _But when we apply such a approach to a particular problem

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we might also be able to leverage some domain-specific heuristics.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _For example
column6: in news we might favor title words actually general. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: We might want to favor title words because the authors tend to

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: use the title to describe the topic of an article.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _If we're dealing with tweets
column6: we could also favor hashtags

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: which are invented to denote topics.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So naturally
column6: hashtags can be good candidates for representing topics. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Anyway
column6: after we have this design scoring function

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: the k topical terms by simply picking k terms with the highest scores.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Now
column6: of course

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we might encounter situation where the highest scored terms are all very similar.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _They're semantically similar
column6: or closely related

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So that's not desirable.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So we also want to have coverage over all the content in the collection.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So we would like to remove redundancy.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _And one way to do that is to do a greedy algorithm

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: which is sometimes called a maximal marginal relevance ranking.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Basically
column6: the idea is to go down the list based on our scoring _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: function and gradually take terms to collect the k topical terms.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _The first term
column6: of course

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _When we pick the next term
column6: we're going to look at what terms have already _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: been picked and try to avoid picking a term that's too similar.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So while we are considering the ranking of a term in the list

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we are also considering the redundancy of the candidate term

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: with respect to the terms that we already picked.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _And with some thresholding
column6: then we can get a balance of _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: the redundancy removal and also high score of a term.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Okay
column6: so after this that will get k topical terms. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: And those can be regarded as the topics that we discovered from the connection.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Next
column6: let's think about how we're going to compute the topic coverage pi sub ij. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So looking at this picture
column6: we have sports

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: these topics.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: And now suppose you are give a document.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: How should we pick out coverage of each topic in the document?

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Well
column6: one approach can be to simply count occurrences of these terms. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So for example
column6: sports might have occurred four times in this this document and _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _travel occurred twice
column6: etc. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: And then we can just normalize these counts as our estimate of the coverage

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: probability for each topic.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So in general
column6: the formula would be to collect the counts of _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: all the terms that represent the topics.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: And then simply normalize them so that the coverage of each

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: topic in the document would add to one.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: This forms a distribution of the topics for the document to characterize coverage

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: of different topics in the document.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Now
column6: as always
column7: when we think about idea for _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _solving problem
column6: we have to ask the question

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: Or is this the best way of solving problem?

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So now let's examine this approach.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _In general
column6: we have to do some empirical evaluation _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: by using actual data sets and to see how well it works.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Well
column6: in this case let's take a look at a simple example here. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: And we have a text document that's about a NBA basketball game.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So in terms of the content
column6: it's about sports. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _But if we simply count these words that represent our topics

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _we will find that the word sports actually did not occur in the article

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: even though the content is about the sports.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So the count of sports is zero.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: That means the coverage of sports would be estimated as zero.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Now of course
column6: the term science also did not occur in _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: the document and it's estimate is also zero.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: And that's okay.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: But sports certainly is not okay because we know the content is about sports.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So this estimate has problem.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _What's worse
column6: the term travel actually occurred in the document. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So when we estimate the coverage of the topic travel

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we have got a non-zero count.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So its estimated coverage will be non-zero.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So this obviously is also not desirable.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So this simple example illustrates some problems of this approach.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _First
column6: when we count what words belong to to the topic

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we also need to consider related words.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: We can't simply just count the topic word sports.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _In this case
column6: it did not occur at all. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _But there are many related words like basketball
column6: game

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So we need to count the related words also.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: The second problem is that a word like star can be actually ambiguous.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So here it probably means a basketball star
column6: but _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: we can imagine it might also mean a star on the sky.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So in that case
column6: the star might actually suggest

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So we need to deal with that as well.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Finally
column6: a main restriction of this approach is that we have only one _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _term to describe the topic
column6: so it cannot really describe complicated topics. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _For example
column6: a very specialized topic in sports would be harder to _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: describe by using just a word or one phrase.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: We need to use more words.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: So this example illustrates some general problems with

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: this approach of treating a term as topic.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _First
column6: it lacks expressive power. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Meaning that it can only represent the simple general topics
column6: but _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: it cannot represent the complicated topics that might require more words to describe.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Second
column6: it's incomplete in vocabulary coverage

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: meaning that the topic itself is only represented as one term.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: It does not suggest what other terms are related to the topic.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Even if we're talking about sports
column6: there are many terms that are related. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So it does not allow us to easily count related terms to order

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: conversion to coverage of this topic.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _Finally
column6: there is this problem of word sense disintegration. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: A topical term or related term can be ambiguous.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _For example
column6: basketball star versus star in the sky. _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: _So in the next lecture
column6: we're going to talk _

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: about how to solve the problem with of a topic.

name: 3 - 2 - 2.2 Topic Mining and Analysis- Term as Topic (00-11-31).srt
text: [MUSIC]
